etymology.description: 现(現) ‘present; appear’ + 金 ‘metal; money’ = money on hand, cash.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of something present/at hand with money to mean funds immediately available in physical form. Often contrasted with deposits, credit, or non-cash payments.
etymology.simplification: 現 → 现 by simplifying 見 to 见 to reduce strokes; 金 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 请准备一些现金(請準備一些現金)。
我没有带现金(我沒有帶現金)。
这家店只收现金(這家店只收現金)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā diàn zhǐ shōu xiànjīn.
